description: Even minus odd extensions of truncated 3 X 2n grid diagram.
comments: Number of standard tableaux of shapes (n-1,n-1,k), k=0,1,...,n-1. Example: a(3)=12 because there are 2, 5 and 5 standard tableaux of shapes (2,2), (2,2,1) and (2,2,2), respectively. - _Emeric Deutsch_, May 25 2004Contribution from _Joel B. Lewis_, Oct 05 2009: (Start)Also the number of standard shifted Young tableaux of shape (n + 1, n, n - 1).Also the number of 2143-avoiding up-down permutations of length 2n - 1. (End)
references: F. Ruskey, Generating linear extensions of posets by transpositions, J. Combin. Theory, B 54 (1992), 77-101.
formula: multinomial(3n; n-1, n, n+1)/(n(2n-1)(2n+1)).a(n) ~ 3^(3*n+1/2) / (8*Pi*n^4). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 13 2014
crossrefs: 2143-avoiding up-down permutations of length 2n are given by A005789. [From _Joel B. Lewis_, Oct 05 2009]
author: Frank Ruskey
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 24 1999
